reviews:
Kolor ciemno bursztynowy, klarowny. Piana biała, ogromna, zbudowana z drobnych pęcherzyków charakteryzuje się długim czasem redukcji. Obficie zdobi szkło.
Aromat słodowy, biszkoptowy, z akcentami karmelowymi. Nuty chmielowe mało wyraźne, owocowe.
Smak przyjemnie goryczkowy z odrobiną słodyczy w tle. Goryczka ma charakter zestu cytrusowego, nie jest imponująco wysoka, jej moc uwalniana jest z czasem.
Wysycenie wysokie, szybko zasyca. Tekstura gładka. Ciało pełne, wysokie. Posmak długi wytrawny.

It pours a slightly amber gold color with a medium sized white head. I smell citrus, pine, resin and hints of tropical fruit. It is very bitter for an APA, it's really more of an IPA. I taste resin, pine and a dank taste. I thought this was a good beer. I'm dinging my taste & overall rating because it seems to be an IPA and not a APA.
0,355l can from Beer Republic webshop. Caramel, and biscuity malt. Still quite hoppy on the finish some citrus too. Nice bitter finish.

Goudkleurig helder bier met een gebroken witte schuimkraag die mooi blijft staan. Geuren zijn van citrus maar ook een beetje karamel. Beide niet heel uitgesproken. Smaak heeft een mooie bitterheid die ondanks het aantal IBU's niet overheerst.

12oz Dose. Dunkelgelbes fast klares Bier mit festem flachem Schaum. Wenig Aroma. Getreide? Auch im Geschmack unauffällig. Bitternoten, Getreide, angebrannter Karamell. Richt bitteres Finish. Für mich ein enttäuschendes Bier.
Llauna beer republic. Més West Coast que Apa. Citrica, resinosa, punt dolç. Ben equilibrada. Molt bona
Turbid golden/amber beer with a slight off-white head. Medium aroma; taste starts medium sweet and ends slightly bitter and dry. Caramel, orange, pine, hops and citrus. 7/4/7/3
Very nice APA. 6.5% abv really hits the spot. Not overly hoppy but a decent amount. It goes down fairly smooth. I can’t complain. Very nice. Give it a try. Cheers.

Can from Beer Republic. Clear dark golden, stable, frothy, white head. Aroma of pine, red apple, fried onion, pepper, biscuit, grapefruit peel, pear. Taste has sweetish apple, pear & mango; bitter core of grapefruit, pine and spices over a biscuity malt body. Piney, slightly resinous hoppy finish with red fruits, grapefruit peel, citrus flesh and yeast. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Exemplary, and very neat.

Found this at a liquor store. Definitely more of an IPA than a pale, but still good nonetheless. Flavor is bright, crisp and line grapefruit. Not amazing, but a legendary beer regardless. I believe this to be one of the first micro brews put in a can. Decent stuff.
Dark golden color with high white head. Aroma: caramel, hard candy, citrus hops. Taste: hard candy, citrus notes, high bitterness.  Medium body, moderate carbonation. Okay, good but not great.
Oskar Blues Dale’s Pale Ale 6.5%. Amber, barley malt aroma, full bodied, barley malt, resinous pine, stewed citrus, marmalade, spices. Gorgeous APA from Longmont, Colorado 🇺🇸
Fruity and malty nose. Sweeter than expected. Bitter-sweet, piny hoppy finish.

Creamy off white head left a spotty cover on an amber coloured body.
Fruity & malt aroma.
Medium bodied, soft with a sharp back.
Pine, resinous, bitter citrus & pithy tastes with a big hoppy finish.
Class!
12 oz can poured into a pint glass. Not spectacular, but still, worth trying yourself. Seems like the initial excellent taste kinda quickly dropped off. On balance, a solid APA.
Can courtesy of Luke, fuck knows where he got it. Clear red amber with a lacy white head. Odd malty aroma. Barley sugar, earthy stone fruit and gravel flavour, not pleasant.

355ml can from Dunell's in Jersey. Pours dark amber with a white head. Aromas & tastes of orange peel, grapefruit, earth, caramel, grain, toffee, pine & malt. Medium body. Moderate bitter finish. Highly enjoyable old school ale, more IPA than APA

canned. Clear copper pour with a medium white head. Aroma is mild with grains, earth, straw and caramel. Taste is bitter-sweet with sticky caramel, sticks and twigs. The malt backbone is tried and true producing a decent palate. Finishes bittersweet. Overall: much of this score is for sentimental reasons. I first tried tis back in say 2007 and I loved it then, it blew me away. Each and every time I have revisited it since then it has held up well--Like SNPA. And like SNPA there will always be a place for this beer at my table.

Not bad..A lol more carmelized, sweet than I was expecting..I was hoping for a more crisper, lighter, dry type of ale..This one definitely has the more feel of a Amber, sticky, candied, but I won't kick it out of bed😉 This beer unfortunately isn't what I thought it would be...

Mörk bärnsten/rödaktig
Doft: godis-ish, sockervadd/bränt socker?
Smak: apelsinzest/bittert

Dark amber colour, creamy head.
Aroma: hops, orange peel, caramel, grass, toffee, caramelised orange peel, cotton candy.
Taste: hops, orange peel, caramel, grass, some caramelised fruits.

Can out of a sampler pack. Pour into pint glass. Dark amber color with  a good head and lots of lacing. Medium body with a very nice balance between malt and hops. Pine and earthy notes. I didn't think this would be this good based on the gas station beer logo on this brew but goes to show you you can't judge a beer by the can it's in. This is a premium example of an APA.
Some pale ales are okay. This one is not a rebut for taste. Its pretty strong for a pale, but still not worth it.

(Can) Clear, medium-orange amber body with a medium to large foamy off-white head; slight lacing. Malty caramel aroma, some hops. Medium-plus body, oily mouthfeel, medium creamy carbonation. Flavor malty, mild to medium hoppy; caramel, grain, hint of citrus and honey.
On tap at Das Beer Garden. Clear amber. Smells of pine hops and caramel malt. Tastes of grapefruit and pine hops with a slight caramel malt backbone. Medium body.  Good, of course.
Can. Malty aroma and taste, light hoppy notes, medium bitter. Medium body, malty and hoppy bitter finish. Ok.
Just a little too bitter. A very hoppy and piney American pale. Not terrible, but just okay.
355 ml can. Hig hops smell, golden color, big head. Astringent taste, full in the mouth and cool

Birra color ambra dalla bellissima e abbondantissima schiuma morbida e molto persistente. Aroma non molto intenso, in bocca abbiamo ananas, resina, citrico e il classico luppolo ben presente nelle IPA americane. Una buona bevuta.

355ml can. Pours intense red amber, with fine whitish foam. Aroma is hoppy, piney. Body is average, with low carbonation. Taste is medium bitter, with a clear malty sweetness base. Final is a little thin and short.

Pours bronzed amber with a fluffy white head. Aroma of pine, licorice. Taste has a nice blend of malts, sweet like a pilsener, lots of hops, nice bite. Palate has mild resin, lots of pine, some citrus. Light but packed with hops. Good.
Copper color, tan head, and citrus and pine aroma.  Lacing.  Flavor has a slightly sweet malt backbone with a bitter hop evergreen and grapefruit finish.  Has enough hop bitterness to be an IPA.

The biscuit malt and hop profile mesh well together.   I have been drinking my share of Oskar Blues lately.  Dales’s Pale Ale was the 1st I ever had from the brewery.  Surprised I did not rate until today.
Schönes Kupfer im Glas, in der Nase hopfig, im Trunk eher dunkle Noten, erdig, Wurzelholz, Karamell, trotzdem lecker.

fist review great effort good find this is the one that's easily found unbelievable ABV definite malts and not much hops on the nose. It has a nice finish though and seemingly good quality. Bittered by hops and bready from malt. Last one says brewed 9/30 or about 2 month ago

Pour from can is light amber with nice thick head that lingers and laces well. Malt dominates early that gives into bitter citrus that lacks zip. Light bodied and watery. Balanced and steady but not earth shattering.

If you appreciate a malt presence in your ale, this should be a ‘go-to’.  The balance is superb.  The mouthfeel is off the charts (in terms of substantial presence).  A wonderful throwback to an earlier era of craft beer.

Poured from 12 oz. can. Brown with a decent head.  Nice nose with biscuit, hops, roasted malts and a touch of caramel.  Taste is robust with a good balance of hops and malts, slightly on the bitter side.  Yum.  Good mouthfeel.  Lacks a bit of dimension...  but is straightforward...  no fruity vibe as with some other ales that are highly rated (ex: Bell's Two Hearted Ale).  The can could use a graphics update, it does not do justice to the beer contained within.

Lattina. Sentori il luppolo vanno a dare soddisfazione al naso. La finezza olfattiva è normale e il modo in cui permane è sufficiente. Il manto mantello birroso superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma che resiste abbastanza. La grandezza delle bollicine è a grana medio-fine. Il liquido è di apparenza velata. Il colore è ambrato. Il corpo è strutturato. L'amaro è carico. La forza gustativa è elevata e la persistenza è buona. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di amaro. Il finale è amarognolo. Il retrogusto è intenso. L'aroma in bocca porta i segni di miele, frutta secca, agrumi, pompelmo, spezie e mango.

Re-rating (previous 3.4) Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 18B). Can 35.5 cl - batch 149 (BBF unknown - Canned on ??/01/20). AROMA: medium oxidized hop aroma (isovaleric, slight pine). medium-low toffee-like malt background. APPEARANCE: amber color and clear. medium off-white head with good retention. TASTE: medium-low to low hop flavor with a pine character and oxidation (isovaleric). medium-low to low malt background with a toffee-like character. medium to medium-high bitterness with a dry and bitter finish and a slight note of hay. PALATE: medium-light body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: an american pale ale with its color almost at the amber ale range, reflecting its malt flavor. The hops are oxidized.

Color ambar y con buena espuma. Perfecto balance entre malta y lúpulo. Peligrosamente bebible. De las cervezas que más bebí en 2017-2018. Estuvo durante un año casi imposible de conseguir en España y parece que por suerte ahora la vuelven a traer.
Can 33 cl from SB. Amber with a nice white head. Malty with caramel notes and medium carbonation. A well balanced beer.

Poured into a glass from a can. Light nose. Nice amber color with a thin head. Great hop punch. Nicely balanced with malts and bitter hops. Centennial is one of my favorites, and it’s one of four in this brew. Great taste and value. Cheers!

Can@home, from BeerRepublic. Medium, averagely balanced nuances of slightly bitter and hoppy malts, some caramel. A hint of dry fruits. Distinctive hop profile with nice combination of European and American hops. Medium taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with hoppy caramel malts. Medium/light body with medium carbonation. Overall, good quality and distinctive product that brings America and Europe nicely together. 5 4 8 3 15

Birra ambrata scarica con sciuma bianca presente, profumi citrici e resinosi, gusto prevalentemente amaro soprattutto nel finale ma ben bilanciato da una buona parte maltosa, ottimo il retrolfatto che riporta aromi di arancia amara e resinoso

Pours a smooth orangey copper with excellent foam, smells of soft vegetal hops and couch farts. Flavour is good maltiness with some nice piney hops; not working exceptionally well together but still pretty decently mended. Nice full mouthfeel with great oiliness. For a macro pale ale it's all kinds of good, there are better ones out there for sure but perhaps none as ubiquitous as this one.
Tap @ Oliver twist, Stockholm. Pours an amber colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and hoppy with notes of caramel, dried fruits  and pine. Dry finish.

355 ml can. Clear bright amber colour, medium head mostly lasting, fair lacing, soft carbonation. Nose is herbal, grapefruit, pale malt. Flavour is light sweet, medium bitter, light caramel, grapefruit, bread. Long lasting and pronounced bitter finish. Very good!

Can bought at BCL in June 2019, $3.60 CAD.
Attack: crisp creamy bite
Mids: sweet light bready-grainy barley malt, lvl5-sweetness, light metallic hops
Finish: subtle bitter hops
Overall: excellent balanced sweet barley malts, very nice mouthfeel, smooth drinking.
Lightly malty with toast notes with a big resinous hop profile. Light sweetness is followed by a ponounced yet balaced bitterness.

Pours a clear, deep amber coloration with a medium, fluffy head. Smells of biscuity, slightly grainy and caramelly malt and floral, citrus hops. Taste follows the nose, with a good balance of biscuity, grainy, caramel malt and floral, citrus hops with notes of tangerine and lime peel, as well as some pine. Finishes with a medium bitterness and some citrus and pine lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation.

This seems like a classic East Coast Pale Ale, or rather IPA, really, at 6.5% ABV. Quite a strong malt base with some floral, citrus hops and pine. This is keeping it simple, but is quite expressive and well-balanced, making for a not-too-complex, but rather enjoyable brew.

Can, 50 cl. Pours a clear golden with a frothy white head. Aroma is malty with some caramel. Taste is burnt toast and dark caramel, coffee, grapefruit. Medium carbonation. Very interesting beer with a nice balance between caramalts and American hops.
Delivers on  the promise of hops. Has a strong pine and grass taste as well as orange peel. I expected more given the reputation of the brewery.
Can bought both in Colorado Springs and in sweden. Has a nice hoppy/malty aroma kind of like a darker IPA, taste is a good balance between hops and malt with a little bit of sweetness at the end.
0.473l can. Clear amber color with nice white/beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, citrus, hops, honey and pine. Taste is bitter and sweet.

Can. Clear light black tea body, medium white frothy head with good retention and lots of lacing. Aroma of quince marmalade, apricots, acacia honey and caramel malt. Taste of grapefruit zest, orange jam, bitter herbs and caramel. Lovely.

can.  Poured  amber-orange with a creamy lasting head. Malty aroma with a hoppy touch.  Medium bodied, lower creamy carbonation, with a dry finish.  Flavour of caramel malt, a bit of a woody, herbal hop note, faintly peppery with some bitter citrus peel. Nice for a mere 6.5% abv.

(22/08/2019) Pint on tap at Elephant Room, Austin, Texas. Colour is surprisingly dark for a pale ale, almost copper/amber. Aroma of hops, grapefruit, bittersweet malts, spices. Big flavour, grapefruity, juicy, piney, spicy yet quite malty. Medium body. Perfectly balanced bitterness and sweetness. Hops and malts both coexist in harmony in this wonderfully put together ale. Complex taste but easy to drink at the same time. Absolutely delightful.
Rich color, flavorsome, great head that stays the journey, it has a kick too, as it should,  I buy 12 x can box in Fairways, top class beer in the American pale ale style.
Can. Hazy golden, off-white lace. Classic West coast, not overwrought, dry, peach and pine finish.

can - pours a deep gold ale with a massive tight pored white cap that lasts and laces...Aroma is earthy, musty, malty...Flavor is a delight, big chewy malt mix balanced with piney bittering hops , some woodsy- earthy tones, malty but not sweet (great attenuation)...rounded full rich mouth feel....moderate wet finish in balance with bittering appearing at the end...soooo drinkable...sturdy satisfying tasty ale...if this was available all the time in my locale it would be my go to PA and in my bike saddlebags  or back pack all the time...benchmark craft pale ale
19.2 flOz can for 2$. Copper color, nice head and good carbonisation. big malt flavour, and a strong piney hop flavour. Tastes like brown Sugar or cane Sugar was added. I'll buy this more often.

From the bootlegger in Paris, trying this can, as usual, at home, in Epalinges. A classical and well built pale ale, like a lot of time, you get a strong resinous note, pine-tree, malty, side of sugar and aromatic with a really tasteful bitterness. You get for the eyes, a nice and classical body, average carbonation, white foam.

12 oz. can pours a deep gold/ light copper color, yielding a one and a half finger head of rocky foam that leaves a lacing along the glass.  The aroma is hoppy, leaning slightly more toward the citrus side.  The mouthfeel is moderately full with nice carbonation.  The taste is hop forward, though there is a fairly strong malt backbone to stand up to the four hops used.  The hop flavor is balanced, with notes of citrus and a slight piney bite.  Overall, this is a good example of an American Pale Ale.
Deep gold. Moderate white head. Nose: malts, faint tropical and floral notes. Medium body. Taste: pure hoppy, with a clean malt base on it. Robust bitterness. Nice old school.

12 oz can. Smells of grapefruit with some tropical notes. Dark orange and clear in color. Malt forward with a nice, slightly citrus, mild bitter hop bite at the end. I like these Pale Ales with a full range of flavors throughout the sip. Nice subtle pithy bitterness at the end. Nicely balanced.
Utseende Uklar gylden med offwhite skum. Aroma sitrus malt karamell humle. Smak sitrus appelsin brød malt humle. Fruktig og bitter. Boks smakt August 12

Burk 355 ml från Systembolaget. Bärnstensfärgad med tjockt skum som lägger sig som ett lock på ytan, nära högsta betyg. Doft av humle, aprikos och apelsin. Smak av humle, grapefrukt, bröd, aprikos och kåda. Rejäl beska. Mer IPA än APA enligt mina smaklökar.
0,355 l can like typical in America. Very good and tasty beer in my mind, tnx

Pours a slightly hazy amber colour with a lasting foam off-white head. Biscuit malt aroma with a hint of fruit such as pineapple. Taste is biscuits, malts, caramel, very mildly hoppy for the smell. Light biscuit bitterness to finish. Medium palate and light carbonation.

(12oz can - part of a mix 15-pack "Canobration")
AROMA: soft malt and grain, hint of caramel and wood (almost bourbon-ish)
APPEARANCE: light amber/copper, clear, a very nice billowy hint of beige head
TASTE: malt/grain forward, sweetness (brown sugar), dried/reduced stone fruit, much more intensity than i was expecting, earthy, smokey, herbs/spice, touch soapy and metallic
PALATE: approaching medium body, crisp and bright upfront, smooth and slick middle, gives way to bitter finish

OVERALL: pretty good. better than i expected. it has a very nice head but the color looks iike a watered down amber or IPA, but it does have a decent punch of flavor, not ultra complex but nice and a little chewy, worthy of a try and even keeping a few around.
Great hop forward beer with some backdoor fruit. Well balanced, a must try for the IPA drinker. Just what the doctor ordered after a hard day.

33 cl blik. Helder oranje van kleur, middelfijne romige witte schuimkraag. De geur is citrus en karamel. Smaak is zoet, licht droog karamel, grapefruit, abrikoos en ananas. Medium lichaam, veel koolzuur. Bier loopt uit de blik.

Nice beer with some fruits and nice aftertaste. Somewhat bland and watery but not too much.  Nice aftertaste.  I am used to the the stronger IPA beers so this is why I am not crazy about this one. Not very juicy still it is a good beer!

Recently enjoyed a pint of this renowned brew from the famous can (of course) - poured a hearty caramel amber-orange color with a foamy white head, looks more intense than your average pale ale. Earthy and herbal hops on the nose, along with notes of classic cascade hops. Taste is a slightly toasty and caramelized malt with a cascade hop bitterness that builds over the course of the pint. The hop flavor also almost has an English-style flair to it, with subtle fruity and earthy hop notes. Medium-bodied, smooth, but a bit "chewy" in the mouthfeel. Although the flavor profile is very true-to-style for an APA, this is distinctly heftier on the palate and I imagine could be pretty filling rather quickly. Overall a nice change-up if you're looking for a stockier rendition of a Sierra Nevada or Kona Fire Rock pale ale.

Nice amber clear pour with a creamy off white layer of a head. Biscuits, malts, toasted brown bread, ripe fruit like peach or pineapple comes to mind, caramel, very mildly hoppy for the smell. Not overly bitter, halfway medium sweet with a little bit of sour flavors. Medium mouthfeel and the right amount of carbonation. Loving it, more complex than one would expect.

APA de color ámbar con espuma blanca de retención media. Aroma potente a lúpulos resinosos y herbáceos junto con maltas caramelo y miel. Sabor refrescante y equilibrado. Buen contraste entre el Dulce del cereal y el amargor de los lúpulos. Notas de fruta cítrica y sensación floral y oleosa. Una cerveza compleja pero fácil de beber. Un buen ejemplo de este estilo americano ideal para acompañar una hamburguesa Black Angus.

Pours deep amber to copper with a thick offwhite head. Aroma is citrusy. Taste is moderately bitter and slightly sweet. There are notes of citrus, toffee, and something like diesel. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. It’s not bad but I probably won’t buy again.
Nice IPA, been waiting for this one for a while, part of the LCBO Spring 2018 Beer program, a good IPA.

Flasche in einem Whole Foods in New York.
Dunkles gelbes und klarer Körper, viel Schaum.
Schön fruchtiges Aroma (Südfrüchte: Aprikose, Maracuja, Ananas), Hopfen
Geschmack: Süssliches Malz (Karamell im Gaumen), wird stärker und dominiert. Frucht  im Hintergrund und nicht dominierend (Aprikose, Maracuja)
Wenig Bitter.

2 month old can from canundrum mix 15
A: Poured a finely hazed deep burnt orange with a very small head. 
S: Sweet orange, faint pine and caramel.
T: Strong and bitter taste with leafy, earthy and zesty citrus hops balanced by toasty and lightly sweet malts. Candied orange aftertaste.
M: Medium body and stiff carbonation. Fairly clean finish.
O: Good and well balanced, a nice autumn beer but not one I'd seek regularly.
Amber with a pillowy off white head. Smells of toffee, herbs, piney, dried dark fruits. Soft, good sweet-bitter balance. Dry finish.
Offers pine and light fruity notes, a solid bitterness - just like we are used it back home. Was as well just a fresh delivery.
Lovely. Nice amber ale with a pleasant biscuit malt finish. Great depth of flavour.
Probably my favourite mass market beer. Very well balanced with a strong malt backbone, but enough hop punch to break through. Earthy, full mouth feel raises it above the rest. Cracking stuff.
From backlog. 0,3 litre Can from Systembolaget Charlottenberg. Cloudy Dark Golden with white head. Malts, hops, Caramel and fruits.
Can 330 ml at Stockholm Beer and Whisky Festival 2018. Clear amber body with white head. Caramel, malts, fruitiness, hay, bread.

Ambar, nebulosa, abudante espuma blanquecina. Aroma ligeramente resinoso. En boca es muy equilibrada y agradable con excelente base malteada, acaramelada y un rico contrapunto lupulado cítrico. Final seco y notablemente amargo.

355 ml can poured into a tulip glass, appearing a slightly hazy dark golden, topped with a generous, soapy head of white froth, which recedes gradually sticking to the glass. Aromas are hoppy, a mix of fruits and florals, although none distinct enough to standout. Tastes are a similar smooth blend if fruity and pine flavours, caramel sweetness, and some breast malt. Ends with a mild bitter and is nicely medium bodied throughout. No standout flavours, but a good all rounder pale ale.
An almost plain looking Pale Ale with a simple name but "ohho". A really good IPA kept simple as it should be. Yet a complex taste spectrum and a great finish. Very good beer!

Large frothy offwhite head. Excellent lacing. Mostly lasting. Hazy dark-amber body. Aroma: moderate malt, caramel, heavy hoppy, grass, orange. Initial flavor: moderate sweet. Final flavor: light sweet moderate bitter; long duration. Palate: medium body, watery/oily texture body, lively metallic finish. vencida há 33 dias. Dulçor maltado com toques de laranja. Lúpulo com perfil de pinho. The balance is towards the late hops and bitterness, but the malt presence is supportive, not distracting. Moderate to high hop bitterness with a medium to dry finish. Hop flavor and bitterness often lingers into the finish, but the aftertaste should generally be clean and not harsh (appears as flaw). Me lembrou mais IPA que APA. 90s

Tap at Salhojankadun Pub. Pours deep amber with snow white head. Malts, sweet fruityness, floral hops, caramel, grapefruit, apricot, overaged orange. Medium body, average carbonation,  bitter finnish.

Original rating 8-3-8-3-13 from can 355ml at O'Hara's Freehouse 2011-10-22.

19.2 ounce can (more beers offered this way, please). Juts a terrific pale ale. Amber colored, and you can really taste the bready malts. Citrusy NW hops. Firm bitterness and plenty of hops flavor. This would've passed for an IPA some years ago. As is, it's one of the best APAs out there.

Amber with thin beige head
Aroma is malty grainy 
Flava is malty some sweet fruitiness and slight roastones
Feels medium with moderate fizz
Finishes tangy slightly bitter
Solid pale ale but won’t blow you away. Had found this one in Colorado a few year back but now it’s in the neighborhood.
Amber pour, beautiful foamy off-white head. Mild soapy floral aroma. Taste of pine, caramel, some citrus, quite floral, nutty...  A perfectly reasonable pale ale.

Orange, leicht gelbe Farbe mit weißer Schaumkrone. Malziger, fruchtiger, hopfiger Geruch. Geschmacklich malzig, hopfig, fruchtig mit Grapefruit und Citrus, hintenraus trockener. Mittlere Süße mit mittlerer Bitterkeit, leichter bis mittlerer Körper mit spürbarer Kohlensäure. Intensiv und gleichzeitig ausbalanciert.

5/10/18
At scholarship dinner with A. 
Straight from can from Penn bartender. 

Big hop nose. Very strong and floral. Not getting as much citrus as I'd expect from their description.

Taste is floral bitter hops and crisp malt. Tons of hop flavor. Pronounced bitterness with a touch of bready sweetness. Nice amount of bready flavor but without the sweetness. Could easily pass for an IPA. 

Med-thin palate. Would have no problem downing several of these. 

Overall, a great, drinkable  pale ale that’s definitely a floral hop showcase. Equally suited for a real review or for slamming at a party.

Piwo ciemnobursztynowe, raczej klarowne (wytrącają się drobinki białkowe). Piana wysoka, trwała, lepi szkło. W aromacie las, , trawa, karmel, kwiaty. W smaku średnia, trwała kwiatowa goryczka, z wyraźną karmelową kontrą. Wytrawne. Wysycenie średnie.

Tall can from the ice chest at Liberty on The Drive in Vancouver. A reddish amber beer with generous pale head and a faintly hopped and malted nose. Slightly hop forward on the palate with delicious malt background. Maybe (just maybe) the best pale ale I've yet to try. 4

355ml can (6.5%) at home on 29 Apr 2018, present from Andrew C (bb 5 Mar 2019): initial floral, pine aroma becoming more fruity on warming, amber, good off-white head, floral, orange, caramel, biscuit flavour, viscous, sweet hoppy finish.
27-04-18 // can from Getränke Stumpf. Malty body. Fruit aromas of orange, apricot, grapefruit. Moderate bitter. Classic solid Pale Ale.

Very frothy head over a clear, orangy brown. Smells of citrus fruit. This is a nicely bitter beer, with dark tones of malt in the middle, making it seem like an English pale ale done with that extra citrus kick of American pale les. I can taste citrusy hops, but the finish is a sourer bitter that reminds me of Kent hops such as Goldings. There's a slight alcohol intensity in here too. Carbonation is lively, and I got some after-fizz in my nose. So this is a good APA but still just behind Sierra Nevada PA for me. On the other hand, it tastes closer to the traditional English pale ale for me than Sierra Nevada, which overlaps more with the American IPAs. Not that such distinctions matter: this is a good beer--the second I've had from Oscar Blues, and I liked them both.
The beer has got a deep amber colour with a small head and medium body. Aroma of hops and pine. Taste of hops, barley, bread, herbs, flowers and Woods. Hoppy finish.

Elaborado con grandes cantidades de maltas europeas y cuatro tipos de lúpulo americano, ofrece una explosión de aromas a lúpulo, un rico centro de malta y lúpulo, y un final emocionante. Pesa 6.5% de alcohol por volumen.

¿Por qué exprimir una cerveza tan grande en una pequeña lata?

Porque pensamos que la diversión al aire libre requiere una gran cerveza. Nuestras latas van donde las cervezas embotelladas no pueden, donde las cervezas enlatadas sin sabor no pertenecen. Y no importa dónde bebas Dale's Pale Ale, podemos protegerlo de la luz y la oxidación mucho mejor que las botellas.

Northern Brewer para amargor, Cascade y Columbus para sabor, y una gran adición post-ebullición de Centennial para aroma.

From Oct 2006

oured from 12oz can a hazy reddish gold with a large head of foam

The smell is all kinds of hoppy with notes of grapefruit and some grass. There's even a touch of sweetness from the malt in the nose.

The taste is big on hops up front with the grapefruit noted in the smell though the grassiness plays a minor role. Midway through there's a good caramel malt sweetness that offsets the hop bitterness nicely creating some really good balance but..the hops take over again near and through the finish.

Other notes: the body on this pale is really good and the drinkability, despite the 6.5%abv, is very high for me.

Bottom line: This is a great APA! 'nuff said!

DOC: 5/10/2017

2015 BJCP Category: 18B American Pale Ale


AROMA: Strong IPA-level piney/floral hop aroma. Some fruit or berry notes. Firm malt presence creates for confectionery-like sweetness. Clean fermentation. No alcohol. 9/12

APPEARANCE: Deep amber/copper hue (too dark for style, though); mostly clear. Large white froth retains and laces extremely well. 2/3

FLAVOR: Hops dominate the presentation with piney/resiny flavor at beginning and end. Fruity/floral flavors are present at the apex. Malt base is noticeably sweet with a strong caramel/toffee taste throughout. Palette is big and robust in nearly every way - a little too flamboyant for the style, IMHO. 13/20

MOUTHFEEL: Medium to medium-full body; moderate carbonation. Not quite crisp, not quite sticky; though the hops do linger and leave a dry piney aftertaste. Very efficient for 6.5% ABV. 3/5

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Though a delectable brew, this is entirely too big to be considered an APA. If marketed as a AIPA it’d be nearly World Class. 6/10

TOTAL SCORE: 33/50
Bue à la pression. APA très très bien faite. Blonde orangée, ronde, houblon/malt bien équilibrés, assez longue en bouche. Finale très agréable sur l’aromatique. Vraiment chouette.

Overall, this is quite delicious. A great pale ale. I would buy this again, and I would recommend it.

Beautiful deep brown pour with a thick, mushy cap of foam across the surface. This is the bench mark for a bitter hop-forward American pale ale. If you can’t build on it, why bother brewing it? The hops hang like monkeys on trees, with a rich malt base & surprisingly bitter finish. Boom. Great stuff.

Just realized I have not reviewed this beer. Pours golden with a beautiful white foamy head. Smells resiny, piney, well balanced. Tastes bitter, hoppy, This is my daily driver beer. Not an IPA, not a heavy ale, the perfect beer for the grill.
Charakterne, wytrawne, solidne, nie mizdrzące się aromatami tropikalnymi, proste, smaczne piwo.

Can, 355ml. Clear copper colour with a small white head. Aroma of fresh hops, hay and citrus. Flavour has sweet malt, hop bitterness approaching IPA levels, some herbal citrus in the finish. Moderate carbonation. A decent brew.

I was beginning to get sceptical of these highly-rated highly-hopped American craft beers. However, Dale’s Pale Ale is a refreshing (literally) change. Hopped to an excellent balance that is fruity and bitter without being overwhelming, lovely and light on the palate. Smells and looks good too, if a little indistinctive. Definitely recommended.
A nice and tasty hoppy APA, with a bitter ending (slightly too bitter). I wouldn’t mind having more of these.
Decent drinker. Turning into a go to for me. A bit Sweet and bitter with a pine nose
Tried in a Can from Tesco. Rich golden amber colour with a thick off white head. Aroma citrus hop and malts a touch fruity. taste light to mid sweet medium bitter to finish. Medium creamy body.

Caña en el Taxman León 14..04..2017. (r2725). Color ámbar bronce con bastante espuma blanca. Sabores secos herbaceos lupulos viejos y resinosos. Cuerpo ligero algo seco con amargo final resinoso duradero. Bastante buena. Para repetir

["Why have I never reviewed this before?" part 4]
Can, 355 ml. Pours clear light golden amber with at least two fingers width of frothy, dense off-white head. Loads of visible carb, mostly small bubbles, and a little bit of patchy lacing. Head retains for a long time. Sweet and malty on the nose with a fair bit of cut grass and pine wood (not quite resin) coming through. Light touch of banana esters and quite a bit of clove and vanilla; making me think of a sweeter hefeweizen. Light caramel malt holding it all together. Taste is initially sweet and fruity with some blood orange and citrus, giving way to a fairly wood/earthy malt centre with lots of dense toffee, and finishing on a fairly sharp, slightly medicinal and resinous hoppy bitterness. Finish is long and wet with lingering astringent bitterness in the sides of the mouth. Body is medium, texture is smooth but quite thick, carbonation is a soft; fair bit of weight to it and not the easiest drinking. Good stuff.

Amber gold color. Aroma of fruits and pine. The flavour starts with some sweetness from malts with some toffee. And changes throug to a hopp bitter end with some smoked flavor.
Well bodied and medium carbonation.
Amber hoppy beer. Some nice malts coming through with sweetish hops. Nice smooth texture and amber color. Decent american ale.

355 ml can from Tesco, London, UK. Colour is amber golden, with a medium, foamy, frothy, creamy white head. Aroma is hops, fruity, malts, spices. Taste is light sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation. Medium bitter finish.

Can, from Tesco. Deep copper gold, thin but lasting white head and gentle condition. Solid burnt toffee, sweet caramel, a little spiciness and an earthy citrus hop note in the nose, full bodied in the mouth with a delicate earthy sweet toffee note underpinned by a solid hop bitterness that remains insistent but never demanding. Finish allows the sweet toffee to re emerge but theres still a balancing earthy hop bitterness underneath and a fruity retronasal hop resin note.

Buen aroma frutal y floral.
Buen aspecto con espuma persistente.
En boca balanceada con fruta madura al principio para terminar con un amargor citrico y frutal muy agradable.

330ml can from Tesco Gateshead served cool in a 1/2 chalice. Hazy gold with a white head Tropical aroma, similar flavours, but unremittingly sweet: I enjoyed the juicy palate, but yearned for some resinous bite or sharpness

330ml can. This is new to the UK ..I’ve had this before anyway . A good beer to drink while fishing in a polluted river or in the morning when you’ve given yourself the day off. Drunk direct from the can ,you feel manly , tough and very repressed macho tribal. Damn liberal elites wanna ban free speech, masturbation and drinking pale ale early in the morning. You call this dysfunctional ? I call it liberty. Dales Pale has Gary’s thumb up. Good shit.

355ml can from Tesco. Sweet pale malt with juicy hops that are gently assertive without edging into aggression. Quite strong, but that’s not really noticeable in the malt. This is like a strong lager with modern hops. It’s quite drinkable - I think the balance is OK. On the whole I think I prefer drinking a strong Euro lager, but there is a place in my life for an occasional one of these.

Great, resonous, sweet and malty nose, substantial floral and citrus hops, too; well balanced assertive malty and hoppy flavor, earthy and piney with a sweet front end and substantially bitter and quick finish; slick and a bit dry palate; perhaps the best can of beer ever.

Can from Beergium. Aroma is fruity hops, sweetish caramel malt, touch of orange, pine resin. Flavour is moderate sweet with a bitter finish. Body is medium, nice smoothness. Very drinkable balanced hoppy malty APA!
From 32gp. Can. In Teku glass. Watching Los Soprano 4x04. Pretty oily, some caramel and piney hops. Ultra drinkable with a really long pleasant aftertaste. After one I want another. Abv well hidden
From a can. Great example of the style, heaps of hops and dangerously drinkable.
That’s a thing then. Aroma is a bit stilted but the bitterness and flavours this as are cracking and large.
Can 0,5. Pours clear golden with medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma of malts, hops, citrus, caramel. Taste of caramel, citrus, floral, grapefruit. Medium body and carbonation.
12 oz can pours amber with a white head. Aroma of citrus, fruits, caramel and floral. Taste is caramel, grapefruit and spice.

Pression à La Mise En Bière - De couleur dorée avec une fine mousse blanche crémeuse - Au nez des arômes malté et herbacé, levure assez neutre, houblons floraux, nez léger - En bouche bonne amertume apparait, toujours pascal de houblons floraux, notes herbacées, les malt on de la place pour s’exprimer - Corp léger, amertume moyenne, carbonation correcte, sèche et amère, final amère et herbacé
On tap at Brother’s Beer. Pours amber. Caramel, biscuit, apple, lemon. Good malty pale ale.
Si te apetece una pale ale decente y sin arriesgarte esta es la tuya, facil de tragar, con buen cuerpo y con los aromas afrutados justos, muy bien

Pours a clean amber colour with a big warm creamy head, great retention and some nice foamy lacing. Aromas of an Imperial IPA with the grassiness and caramel malts. Then, I get some rustiness, which seems to disappear after a while. Good. The taste is pretty mild at first with the caramel and then, finally the hops showing late in the finish. This creates a decent bitterness with nice dryness. Feels more like an IIPA than a pale ale.
Light amber with a white head, some lacing and a spicy, mildly hoppy nose. Mild, malty mouthfeel with a pleasant, caramel, long-lasting, hoppy finish.

Pas mal, peut-être un peu vieille aussi.
Légèrement alcooleuse. Au nez pas mal de citron et fond légèrement orange.
Bouche : assez agrumes, un petit fond malté. Fnale plutôt sèche et longueur vraiment pas mal !
12 oz can pours amber with a white head. Aroma of citrus, fruits, caramel and floral. Taste is caramel, grapefruit and spice.

355ml can from LCBO. Pours a fairly big frothy off-white head and has a pale golden appearance. Thick dirty lacing. Aromas of light roasted malts, earthy and herbal hops. Flavours are a mix of malt and hop notes. Earthy hops and slight bitterness. Some subtle caramel as well as bready malt hints. Good balance of sweetness and bitterness. Quite easy to drink and plenty flavourful.

Can, 0.355l. Clear deep amber color with medium soapy off-white head, good lacing and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of citrus, papaya, passion fruit, pine, herbs and dust. Taste starts with medium sweet toasted and caramel malt, following is grassy with some dried fruity and papery note, mouthfeel is astringent, while finish is heavy bitter. Medium body, creamy texture and lively carbonation in palate. Richer, hoppier and bolder than many IPA’s...

A classic pale ale and a perennial favorite. Strong aroma of hops, which was surprising for a pale ale (would be more expected of an IPA). Had a very nice brown-amber color when poured into a glass, though honestly I had previously always sipped straight from the can like a heathen. Some light bitterness. They are definitely into this drinking from the can thing, which is cool for camping and stuff I guess. A relatively inexpensive and nice brew.

Cette cuivrée aux relents de pins et à la belle mousse couleur crème est d’une limpidité sans reproche. La bouche est délicieusement houblonnée, plus aromatique qu’amère, bien qu’un bon petit coup astringent se pointe à la fin. Des notes de toffee, de caramel fournissent un bon tapis sucré à cette pale ale qui peut prétendre à être un parfait exemple du genre. Irréprochable et bien balancée, elle n’est peut-être pas pour tous les goûts, mais les connaisseurs y trouveront solidement leur compte.

Naranja claro turbio con media corona de espuma de burbuja fina y buena retención; aromas a caramelo , fruta tropical, mango y papaya, ligera resina, miel y flores; en boca entrada media, refrescante, maltosa con amargor equilibrado, notas a malta y florales, retrogusto ligeramente picante, amargo y seco; cuerpo medio pleno con correcto carbónico, cerveza compleja, bien elaborada y perfecta en estilo.

Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2010 (Day 1), Earl’s Court, London Aug 2010 - Dark amber in colour. Exceedingly Hoppy for an APA; piney resinous oily and earthy hops. This special batch had a little twist however - Dry-hopped with Centennial. Assertively hopped and very bitter. Should be classed as an IPA. (2010-08)

Can. Clear orange/amber colour, rocky, slowly diminishing white head, good lacing. Faint floral and grassy aroma. Light sweet, light to medium bitter taste of caramel, flowers, leading to a grassy bitter finish. Light to medium body, average+ carbonation. Bland and very disappointing.

Couleur cuivré avec une belle effervescence. Une mousse onctueuse et riche. ça sent la céréale, le sucre, le houblon. Une belle texture en bouche. Une bonne touche de céréale, de sucre avec un bon coté citronné et une amertume fort agréable et persistante!

Tall cans are a bit much for this type of beer, 2 had me well past halfway there! Has all the bitter/aroma hop balance you’d expect in a pale but with a managable finish to keep it sessionable. Nice colour and consistant through the 4/5 places I had it .

355ml can from Tesco. 
Medium sized white head disappears quickly, good lacing. Clear amber body. Nose is resin, pine, caramel. Flavour is caramel, resin, grapefruit. Good bitterness on the aftertaste. Medium carbonation, spiky mouthfeel, nice little bit of chew. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Pours clear copper colour with at least 3 finger tall off white head. Aromas of citrus and woody hops with some pine deep down in the glass. Flavour is mildly piny, light malt and a good amount of hop bitterness. The malt has a short finish with the hops going much longer.Medium bodied and very soft feeling on the tongue.

355ml can. "Canned on 10/03/16". Purchased 01/06/17. A classic LCBO two month wait before seeing a shelf may have affected the freshness of the hops, but it’s decent. Pours clear and the colour of honey with a creamy light beige cap. On the nose, British-like caramel malt profile, resinous hops, pineapple, and heavy mineral notes. Taste wise, crisp hard water, caramel malts, light citrus, and metallic hops into more mineral crispness, resinous notes, and citrus pith in the finish. I would LOVE to try this fresh because it almost comes across as a Fuller’s London Pride/American Pale Ale hybrid, and as a fan of both styles I mean that very much as a compliment. Here’s to Ontario’s 100 year old liquor laws! Huzzah!

It pours copper with amber highlights; the head is off white and foamy. The aroma has notes of: toffee, grapefruit zest, mango, and cereal. The taste is lightly bitter. The palate is light bodied with medium carbonation, and has a short finish. Overall, it’s meh.

Âmbar escuro de leve turbidez, espuma bege de media formação e persistência. Aroma tendendo ao caramelo, leve amadeirado, nada extraordinário como esperava. Paladar de leve dulçor e amargor. Corpo leve média carbonatação. Final de leve/média persistência, tem um tom amadeirado. Boa mas não correspondeu à nota do RB.

6.5%ABV. Pale Ale.

Poured out amber. 12°SRM.

Nose is malty sweet, orange maybe a hint of pine.

Mouthfeel is soapy. Palate has toasted malt with toasted grahams, honey on wheat toast, barley or multigrain toast. Hops are bitter melon, deep heavy grapefruit peel, resinous, sappy.

Finish is long with a pronounced back of the tongue lingering bitter.

Overall a big big hoppy ale, whose ginormous grain bill will largely go unnoticed. It’s really what allows you to really appreciate all of that hoppy complexity.

Goes on Favorites List!
Can. Pours brown/amber. Aroma of caramel, bread and citrus. Mild sweet with moderate pithy bitterness. Nothing exciting here.

Draught. Pours a clear amber gold with a medium white head. Aroma is floral hops with some citrus and caramel malt. Taste is caramel up front with citrus underneath and light resin and grain in the finish. Moderate bitterness. Medium body. Somewhat above average carbonation. Oily, slightly sticky mouthfeel.
Can. Pours a clear brown colour with a fluffy white head, aroma is light and hoppy with hints of fruit, taste is bitter and soft malt with a dry bitter finish finish.

Pours a slightly hazy amber color with medium beige head. Aroma has caramel, bread, citrus, pine and tropical fruits. Taste has citrus, grass, pine, grapefruit, slightly tropical fruits and lots of caramel and bread/biscuit. Boozy and bitter aftertaste. I expected much more.
Cannette 355 ml. Couleur cuivrée, mousse beige qui forme une belle dentelle. Arôme de malt sucré et houblon herbeux. En bouche, notes de caramel, malt et un peu de houblon. Amertume moyenne. Bonne

Pours a deep clear orange with caramel earthy aroma with a hint of pineapple. Fair carbonation. Big sweet malty and hop resin taste. Hint of fruit. Slightly bitter palate with lasting malty flavour. Medium body. A treat.
Pours a clear orange beer with a light orange head. The aroma is sweet and quite hoppy, and so is the flavour too - the hops is mainly aroma hops, not much bitterness.

Cor de ouro envelhecido com tonalidade âmbar, translúcida, com pouco brilho e um perlage intenso e persistente; espuma marfim de média/alta formação com alta persistência e bom lacing.
Aroma de caramelo ao leite e biscoito; em segundo plano, lúpulo cítrico de toranja.
Sabor maltado de biscoito e leve crocância com amargor cítrico de toranja desde o início q evolui para um final seco e de amargor intenso equilibrando a base maltada.
Retrogosto seco e de amargor assertivo e muito persistente. 
Corpo e carbonatação médios.
Altíssima drinkabilty.

Lata de @Cimmeria, Oviedo 17/12/2016. 
Color amarillo, sabor caramelo, frutal, lúpulo rica.

355 ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear golden colour with moderate-sized cream-coloured head. Aroma is resin, grains, caramel and a little floral character. Flavour is resiny, slightly floral hops, grains and a bit of caramel sweetness. Average body and carbonation. Nice.

While I’m not a huge fan of this bet i can see how it works appeal to some. Not quite aoale ale but also not an ipa. Mary base with a strong assertive hopping. I prefer pales and ipas to be crisp and clean tasting and this was a bit of the mark for me.

This might be the best beer I have ever tasted.
Heavy hops, accompanied by the usual hops-related aromas.

My first Oskar Blues product and Dale’s apparently is their bell cow. Can, of course, that is poured into a tulip glass. Presence is a medium amber giving a generous, almost white, foam, which leaves a decent lace sip by sip. I get a whiff of melon and grass. A very nice hoppy intro, just a touch of sweetness, leading to a bitter finish. 6.5% alcohol for an APA, not bad. Good start, OB. I will be back.

Can from a local Tesco, consumed at home. Dark gold, almost tawny with a loose white head which dissipates quickly. Massive resinous scent with lashes of mango and white grape. Taste is surprisingly bitter with a suggestion of sour. Notes of orange juice and dry Chablis in the finish, but there is also assertion of the biscuity malt. An incredibly intense pale ale, I’d love to try this one again sometime.

Big foamy off-white head very long lasting.
Clear light amber, darker than a usual pale ale.
Aroma is citrus hoppy and malty with some caramel.
Hoppy bitter taste, citrus, grapefruit,some fruitiness (citrus, tropical) and malty. Bitter aftertaste.
Can from Tesco. Amber with a foamy white head. Soft fruity aroma, flavour is a little harsh: pine, orange, dry and bitter. Ok

Clear light amber color with off-white head. Aroma is quite malty and slightly buttery with some orange and earthy hops. Taste starts also slightly malty but then the hops kick in with earthy bitterness and lingers with grapefruit pith. Medium body and carbonation. Overall it’s a really well made, classic pale ale.
Tastes like a west coast ipa. Harsh pine, orange peel and floral, so many beers like this that I don’t like, must be one of the c hops

Burk från SB. Klar mörkorange med högt, fluffigt vitbeiget skum. Tydliga inslag av granskott, kåda och apelsinzest i doften, tillsammans med lite bröddeg och honung. Mediumkropp, något lättare. Ligger nära i smaken, med en lite stickande och klibbig beska.

Can from J’s. Pours a clearish light amber with a finger of foam that dissipates quickly. Lots of pine resin and orange in the nose, bready malt and sourdough bread. Musty orange on the palate, citrus, good malt character. Medium body, well-balanced. Bitter finish with some lingering pine notes.

Nice Pale Ale, had it from draft at RRT. Golden color, not too heavy and not a bad aftertaste. A pretty good beer that is good for the fall

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from a Tesco in Edin. Pours quite a dark amber for a Pale. Clear. Wee off-white head. Fruity and floral aromas. A little melon. Light marmalade. Good amount of resin. Musky. Has a bit of a peppery heat on the nose. Buttery biscuits. Interesting and fairly fresh. Taste has a biscuity sweetness. Oily orange juice and grapefruit pith. Palate is fairly dry with medium-strength bitterness. Medium to light carbonation. Lasting bitter finish. Slick. Pretty punchy pale.

Can out of my Californian Xmas box. Well, it’s paler than a stout. Not a pale ale but a Crystal-smothered peach bomb all perfumed sponge, bile and throats sweet. The hops cannot be heard above the din of cacophonous batter-sweet peach flan malt sogginess. Bits of menthol and pine. Good looking big lacing head over dark orange beer. Bouquet of vomited Southern Comfort. 
My distaste is easing with the booze. But still.

1 pint 3.2 fl oz. can. Clear deep copper, firm off-white mostly lasting foam. Aroma of citric/floral/spicy hop and caramel malt. Taste is toasted fruity sweet caramel malt well balanced with generous amounts of floral/herbal citrus hop, fairly bitter finish. Average carbonation, medium bodied, well hopped. Solid. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)
Clear amber beer. Zesty aroma with a hit of malt. Rich malty base, sweet lemony citrus, bitter hop. Aftertaste is sharp and bitter.

Pours amber with a large head.
Nose shows biscuity malt, light spicy, woody and herbal hops.
Flavours include biscuity malt, light spicy hops and an aggressive bitterness. Somewhat metallic.
Clear orange body with a medium white head. Aroma is caramel, malty, light grapefruit, pine. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Well balanced.

Can from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear copper beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: sweet caramel malt notes, bread and hoppy with resin hint. Fruity. Taste: medium body with caramel malt balanced with resin and fruity hops. Good attenuation and highly drinkable. Very nice balance good association between caramel malt and resin hops. Aftertaste: sweet wet bitterness. Perfect balance.

Can. Pale copper in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of pale and caramel malts, white grapefruit, a bit of kitchen spice and booze. Spicy citrus upfront on the palate, backed by some substantial pale malt flavor. Medium bodied with a solid bitter finish. Very old school APA in terms of the hop-to-malt balance and bitterness level, but with a bit more refinement. Decent.

Pours clear red golden with good off white head. Aromas of bread and honey with hint of citrus and metallic notes. Smooth carbonation and medium mouth feel. Taste is toffee and Cereal with hint of citrus hops but not much. Medium sweet and light bitterness. An old can but I expected much more...

New batch this time. Aroma is similar. Decent carbonation this time. Much more hop bitterness this time which cuts through the malt sweetness. Still not much hop flavour. Score updated

Can pours a clear orange with a two finger sand head and sticky lacing. Aroma is a wonderful floral woodsy citrus. The flavor is excellent and while initially seems quite muted, is actually just right for the style. Mild bitterness and a solid aftertaste finishes very well.
On tap at Bar Explosive, Jyväskylä. Pours orange colour. Aroma is fruity, balanced, has mango, pine, lemon, a bit bitterish, lively carbonation.

Color ámbar claro, translúcido, con capa de espuma de un blanco amarillento de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación media tirando a baja. Aroma a malta, lúpulo por un tubo y resina de pino. Sabor donde se aprecia la malta, pero prevalecen el lúpulo y ese carácter resinoso que ya se intuye a través del olor. Bastante amarga (casi más una IPA que una American Pale Ale, aunque comprendo por qué la catalogan como American Pale Ale). Muy disfrutable y compleja. Toca muchos ángulos interesantes y a la vez es fácil de beber. Pa repetir, desde luego.

12/20 malty but still taste good, slight bitterness, probably a bit too much of the malt taste for me

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Orangish color with an off-white head. Aroma has notes of resin hops and orange peel. Flavor with a decent bitterness, mild maltiness, light caramelish hints. Bittery in the final.

Can 35,5cl
@ Cervezorama 2.0, Madrid, Spain.
A: Hazy amber.
T: Malt, caramel, citrusy, hoppy.

Can from Beer52. Clear amber and an off-white head and a light fizz. Dusty peppery aroma. Pine, minerals and pepper are the main flavours with caramel and grapefruit behind. Maybe not as full-flavoured or punchy as some examples of the style but does at least feel a little better balanced- the malt is still there behind the hops. Growing and lasting bitterness although again not as bitter as some. Overall not bad, could do with losing some of the minerals.

Tin from beer52 beer club. Lacks aroma somewhat. Orangey head on pouring. Hops by the bucket load which is major plus points from me. Perhaps a slight metallic tang but bearable. Packs a punch at 6.5%

The aroma is malt a little bit of floral hops. Appearance is copper/orange with a decent but if carbonation taste is typical American Pale Ale. Nothing mind boggling but not terrible either. Fairly balanced malt and hop profile. Palate: thin/ medium bodied fairly effervescent. Decent lacing and a thin sheet of white head. Overall- decent APA but somewhat overrated. Would not buy again for the 20$ A 6-pack costs in Canada.

From a 355ml can on 10/9/2016. Pours a deep, quite dark golden with a medium head. Has a light fruity nose. The flavour features lots of sweet citrus and stone fruit followed by some pretty firm hops. Has a medium to full body and average to lively carbonation. A very high quality, flavoursome APA.

On tap at St Augustine’s, Vancouver. Clear golden pour with an off-white head. Just a fantastic pale ale - nice assertive hops on the nose, bright and fruity, tropical fruits, pear, citrus zest. Flavour is nicely balanced, fruity and hoppy while still very drinkable.

0.57 l can from ’Saveur Bière’, canned in July 2016. Clear, dark reddish amber with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish, moderately fruity-resiny aroma of candied orange, strawberry jam, a touch of mango and some pine. Quite sweet and malty, moderately fruity and slightly resiny taste of candied orange, strawberry jam, some caramel, a bit of mango and pine, followed by medium long, moderately bitter, resiny finish. Medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Good old school stuff! Clearly different from today’s standards, but I like it!

Can at home. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma grass,caramel, pine, old school nose, light fruity. Taste is medium bitter with loads of caramel, light bread, pine, flowery hops, citrus. Old school and bit stale. But decent.

Out of the can poured a gorgeous light copper, filtered clear, with a frothy off-white head. Really impressive visually. I got moderately-high grassy and citrus hop notes, along with caramel malt, hay and some earthy undertones. Unfortunately I detected an unpleasant buttery aroma/flavour in my sample, which others in my group perceived as a bruised/rotting apple. Will definitely try this again, as there may have been something off with the glassware or this particular batch (I checked, it was canned 3 months prior to consumption). Evidence of a really great beer here. But was hard to ignore what I was perceiving as a slight off-flavour. Will try again.
Can. Pours amber with a longlasting fluffy white head. Notes of caramel, grapefruit and herbs. A hoppy bitter finish.
Pours a clear copper colour with a white head. Noses fairly malty, somewhat spicy and just lightly hoppy. Round, spicy malty taste with hints og bitter hops. Your father’s craftbeer
The aroma is full of hops, malts, flowers, citrus, caramel, pine and dried fruits. The color is copperlike and caramelish. The taste is full of hops, caramel, citrus and pine. A nice beer!

The quintessential pale ale in my opinion (not Sierra Nevada). Poured from a 16oz can into a pint glass. The head is at 1 finger with fluffy clean white pillowy foam. The color is copper. Bicuity malt on the nose with some citrus mixed in. The flavor is slightly toasty, bready and slightly lemon with a grapefruit finish.

Tap. Pours clear golden. Quite hoppy. Aroma is floral, citrus, orange, pine, caramel, biscuit. Medium body. Balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a clear gold color, with a white head. Aroma of hops. Taste of rich mixture of hops and malts. A very nice pale ale, thumbs up.
Can - pours copper with a big white head. Aroma is floral, caramel, citrus and fruit. Taste is fruity up front with a building hoppy bitterness. Creamy palate.
Can. Hazy light amber color with tiny white head. Aroma - Fruity, floral, grass. Taste - Medium bitterness, medium sweetness, malty, pine, citrus. Smooth.

From draft at the rover, poured an Amber colour with a white head. Nose of crisp malts, sweet caramel, citrus, Candy yeast, light floral, mango, and light resinous pine needles. Taste has more pine bitter in the finish, sweet caramel, and a nog hop bitter aftertaste. Enjoyable ipa

Golden, translucent with medium white head. 
Hay, cereal, floral, and citrus aromas. 
Mostly bitter with some sweet malt flavors. 
Pine and citrus flavors. 
Overall a nice drinkable, hoppy, pale ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml can. Amber colour. Medium white head. Hints of malts, hints of sweetness, hints of barley in the aroma. Slightly bitter, malty beginning. Bit sweet but grassy in the middle. Bitter and malty aftertaste. Rather medium bodied lager.

On tap at St. Augustine’s. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Aroma is candied citruses, caramel. Taste is citruses hoppy bitterness which becomes resiny and quite agressive in aftertaste. Very good IPA.

355ml can. Clear golden orange with a two finger off white head. Aroma: hoppy, citrus, pine, grapefruit, malt. Taste: hoppy citrus and grapefruit nicely blended with malts. Bitter finish. Moderate carbonation and medium body. Well balanced APA.

Can from SB. Nose is very hoppy, fresh citrus, pine and grapefruit. Taste is very full and aromatic. The hops and the malt really blend together to create a rich, bready but still fresh taste. The aroma lingers in one's nose along with the bitterness in the back of the mouth. Really a great beer and I really think it tastes its best when drunk straight out of the can or in a wine glass!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft 3/2/16 (Flying Saucer-Addison)-Pours amber with a nice head. Aroma of hops and slight malt. Taste of the same. This medium bodied brew is well balnced and kicks butt.
Aromas of caramel, pine needles, and melons. Taste is syrupy caramel, pine needles, pineapple, mango, and melons.
Tap @ Konttori. Pours clear amber, thick creamy white head. Caramel, some hops in the aroma. Malty, caramel, some bitterness in the flavor.

On-tap in The BrewDog bar in Barcelona with the RBESG guys on 9th July 2016. Amber pour with an off-white crown. The nose was a pleasant combination of malty molasses and citrus fruit notes: the taste was similar. Easy drinking beer in the Barcelona summer heat.

De tirador a BrewDog Bar Barcelona. Cervesa un pel massa fosca per ser Pale Ale. Bon aroma ben balancejat amb afruitats que recorden al préssec, caramel i resina. En boca es encara més resinosa. Potent en aromes. Molt bona.

33cl can from brewdog online store. Light hazy dark gold to orange color. Thin white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Medium body. Light sticky finish. Aroma is malty, hops, piney, orange, citric, light herbs, spices.

This beer is one of my go too beers, light enough for a hot day but no lacking in flavor. To me it is robust like an ipa, but without the dryness after. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at BrewDog Barcelona. Clear light amber with off white head. Caramel, dried tropical fruits, light grassy and green leaves, creamy dark bread. Medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied.

Pours clear copper with a large off-white head. Smells piney and citrusy. Taste is citrus and pine and malty sweetness. Medium-bodied with a supple texture and average mouth-carbonation, Oskar Blues Dale’s Pale Ale finishes with a soft hoppy bite.

Orange citrus aroma overwhelms but a little caramel sneaks through. The body is big and chewy, really large for the style. A good one for summer but strong enough year-round. Poured from a can (what else?).
can - great amber color and nice malt and hop aroma. Good malt and hop flavor with an ESB finish.

12oz can - Pours amber with orange hint. white head. Good smelling brew with citrus fruit and grassy notes, and a bit of roasted malt. Flavor of a sourdough bread, pop of citrus, and hay. Subtle nuttiness, with some slightly sweet cereal grain. Bitter finish.

Oskar Blues Dale’s Pale Ale is a nice example of the style but not a standout IMHO. Lightly hazy amber pour with a decent head. Low fruity aroma. Taste is malty with a pine background -- not a lot of floral or fruit notes. Dale’s Pale is a decent go to brew.
Good colour big head great lacing chewy texture good mix of hops brings it to life nice can at home

This my 2nd favorite summer time active beer in a can behind Shift beer by New Belgium. This beer is a lot more hoppy than Shift. This beer as an awesome hop aroma and finish with a hearty rich middle.

Finally a Pale Ale not going for full IPA zesty profile. Pours up a light golden color with a nice white head. Malts tastes like an old English ale with a bread skin and sugar background. Quite well balanced into the sweetness of malts. It’s also tea like with some resin and herbal notes to it.
Pours a golden amber. Moderate lacing. Nose a little piney, hints of citrus. Taste is crisp and clean grains and malts. A quality pale ale.

On tap. A beer that basks in its middle-of-the-roadness. It’s fine. It’s kinda hoppy. It’s perfectly alright for drinking at a bar or a ballpark or pretty much wherever. It’s not perfect -- it’s too bitter and kinda boring -- but who can knock a beer for not rising above it’s own normalcy?
Can from Appellation Wines Comely Bank. Pours clear amber. Cinnamon, pine resin, butterscotch. Big flavours, toffee, tropical fruit, bitter, loads of hops, long, spicy finish. Lush.

Can from offie in Warndon. Been looking for this for ages! Worth the wait. Really good brew. Possibly more an IPA than a pale ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear amber, covering lace. 
Full body, moderately flavorful, smooth texture, good carbonation and heat, long palate. 
Bitter, dry. 
Hoppy in a simple way, malty, non-sweet caramel. 
Good but not my style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great pale ale, would definitely have again. Great taste texture, look, and feel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light earthy floral aroma. Pours clear gold amber with a long lasting thick foamy white head. Smooth medium bodied. Bitter edge on the finish. Earthy. Grassy. Not bad.
From a can at drinkstore. Big hop aroma for a pale ale but big malt flavours balnce it well. Really good beer.

Pours dark orange with medium to large head. Aroma: biscuits, oranges, lemon, with a pine tree in the background. Taste is on the malty side, but nicely counterbalanced with pine tree hops. Palate is medium. Very solid, very drinkable, very good.

Pours clear orange with medium beige head. Aroma is fresh and fruity, some mango, sweet tropical fruits, floral notes, cereals, citrus, hops. Taste is also fruity, citrus, some floral notes, fresh hay, some cedar, light hops. After taste contains more hops, flowers and little bit resin. Very nice and refreshing beer.

thick, very oily, caramel, light pine, hop is a bit muted. Taste is bitter oily orange peel, grapefruit, some yeast, not very outspoken, light caramel. Bit oily. Okay, nothing exciting, decent standard basic beer for a brewery.
On the nose has resin, melon, fresh fruit. It has a medium high body of a sweet caramel with a hearthy, meaty feeling to it. So umami. Perfectly balanced with a bitter finish.

Nice aroma of west coast hops. Piney, good. Taste is hops and golden malt. Pine and resin, but not overly bitter. A smooth finish for a pale ale. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A 12 fl oz can with a canned on date of 20th November 2015 and poured into a Mikkeller pint glass. It poured a clear copper colour with a less than two finger slightly off white head that dissipated slowly to a nice puffy layer and left nice stringy lacing. Aromas of a lot of pine and wood with a hint of citrus orange peel zest. Tastes orange citrus with a bitter piney hop in the background and honey caramel malts. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Overall, this was a decent pale ale and easily drinkable.

Pours a light hazy brown with a white head. Nose is a mix of sweet, pine, a little bready. Subtly sweet mouthfeel then the hops kick in but mix nicely with the malts. Not overpowering or too bitter. Nice lingering finish. Good pale ale.

355 ml, can conditioned. Slightly hazy, dark amber, thin head, loads of sediments in the glass. Aroma is piny and spicy, almost peppery. Mouthfeel is fizzy, bitter and dry, long aftertaste. Hops are very present in the taste, and I like it! Can has no date to it, but I think it’s quite fresh. My first Oskar Blues experience. (y)

Poured into a shaker showing lightly filtered honey brown with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows sweet tea & biscuits. 

The palate is well carbonated and light bodied. Lightly sweet with hints of lemon and a moderately bitter finish.
Keg at Brewdog Clapham. Bready and citrus aromas. Spicey funky hops. Lingering bitterness and strong tight carbonation. Very drinkable at 6.5.

Sample from can @ Sur & Bitter, Sandnes. Pours golden, with a big, off white head. Aroma is hoppy notes of apricots and tropical notes, some citrusy notes, and sweet malty toffee. Medium to full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is bitter hops, with pine, citrus and tropical notes of apricots and mango, as well as some malty notes of bread and toffee.

A completely cleae amber body with a quickly settling head. Nose has citrus fruits, resin, caramel and floral notes. Taste is mildly sweet with a hefty bitterness that stays lingering on the palate. Soft carbonation and palate on the richer side with some stickiness. Decent pale ale but I’m left a bit disappointed.
Pours clear yellow with a white head. Aroma of grass, citrus and pine. Taste follows nose
On tap at BBF. Amber colour with white head. Citric and caramel aroma. Sweet, ciric, fruity, caramel and pine taste. Medium body.
Keg @ Brewdog, Manchester. Bright copper-amber with a thin head. Has a sweetened hoppy character, there’s a dry pale ale fruitiness underpinning this.

This beer was meant for me. Seriously hopped up Pale Ale that I can session for hours on end. It’s my staple and I highly recommend a pint to anyone who hasn’t tried it. Aroma: almost a little pine, maybe some citrus. Appearance: Golden. Taste: The bomb. How a Pale Ale should taste. The bar against which all others shall be measured. Palate: not heavy, very smooth. Overall: Duh. It’s amazing.
Can. Golden pour with sweet caramel malts and hops. Bomb pale ale great biscuity malts and resiny hops. Really legit hoppy pale ale. Everything I like in a pale ale.
Very good ale, just a little sweet for me. One of the better pale ales from a can.
Poured from draft at Grill Next Door nice copper color with a thin white head. Aromas of caramel malt notes of citrus and floral tones. Nice light sweetness and balanced bitterness of hop in finish.

Can from Hops & Crafts Exeter,pours golden Amber with a nice white head,aroma of sweet piney hop ,caramel,bread,marmalade & grapefruit,the taste is beautifully balanced piney hop ,grapefruit ,slight pepperiness,marmalade with balancing sweetness,herbal notes & a good malt body ,slowly becoming dry in the finish with more well balanced hop flavours. This is a classic pale ale & absolutely beautifully balanced. Sheer class!!!

Such a distinct flavor for a pale. My go-to for this style. A nice sweetness in the finish to balance the hops.
